items.title: Trump’s first 100 days: key impacts on the tech industry
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Trump administration plans significant layoffs, targeting the Office of Community Planning and Development, affecting disaster relief efforts in North Carolina after Hurricane Helene.
- Resignation of US Digital Service leader Anne Marshall after major staff cuts by Musk's DOGE, highlighting efficiency concerns.
- Trump and Musk's bond discussed in a Fox News interview, with Trump claiming to have given Musk a discount during their settlements.
- Cancellation of NYC congestion pricing approval by the Trump administration, which had been set to raise transit funds and reduce traffic.
- New executive order by Trump for closer oversight of independent agencies, stirring controversy over presidential control over regulatory actions.
- DOGE's reported miscalculations in cost savings lead to criticism and concerns over access to taxpayer data.

items.title: Leaked details reveal potential pricing for Lego’s Nintendo Game Boy
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- The Lego Nintendo Game Boy is expected to release in October 2025.
- Leaked pricing is set at $59.99 for 421 pieces, translating to approximately 14 cents per brick.
- The set number is 72046, aligning with previous leaks about Lego’s collaboration with Nintendo.

items.title: Jeep’s parent company announces ‘hands free, eyes off’ driving feature
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Stellantis introduces STLA AutoDrive, a partial autonomous driving feature aimed at easing stop-and-go traffic.
- The feature is developed but not yet launched due to market and regulatory hurdles, with no specific models announced.
- STLA AutoDrive can operate hands-free at speeds below 60 km/h (37 mph) and is designed to evolve with technological advancements.
- The system includes advanced sensors and is intended for low-speed scenarios, though concerns about driver attention remain.
- Automakers, including Mercedes-Benz and Ford, are pursuing Level 3 features, yet few are available due to regulations and safety caution.

items.title: Amazon now has creative control over the James Bond franchise
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Amazon, MGM, and Bond producers announced a new joint venture for creative control over the James Bond franchise.
- Producers Barbara Broccoli and Michael G. Wilson plan to step back from the franchise after the deal.
- Previous tensions existed between Broccoli and Amazon regarding the franchise's future direction.
- Jeff Bezos publicly asked for suggestions on who should be the next James Bond following the announcement.

items.title: Our Favorite Things: Gear, Gadgets, and Other Stuff
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Overview of favorite gadgets and gear recommended by Verge staff.
- Staff members discuss their preferred social networks post-Twitter's transition to X.
- The article features various categories including social networks, home office items, audio gear, board games, gardening gadgets, and mobile phone accessories.
- Each section highlights the personal favorites of the staff, detailing why they like specific items and how they are used.

items.title: Skylight Calendar Max review: a game-changer for busy parents
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- The Skylight Calendar Max features an AI-powered planning assistant called Sidekick.
- It can sync schedules from various sources to Google Calendar and family calendars.
- Product price starts from $569.99 for the 27-inch model.
- The calendar is designed to help families manage busy schedules more effectively.
- The Skylight Calendar Max has a 2560 x 1440 resolution touchscreen display.
- The AI Sidekick can convert messages and images into calendar entries, saving parents time and effort.
- The product has received mixed feedback regarding its integration and subscription model.

items.title: Xbox Game Pass was supposed to be the Netflix of gaming — what happened?
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Xbox Game Pass launched in 2017, aiming to create a Netflix-like gaming experience.
- Despite some success, Xbox still ranks third in console sales behind Sony and Nintendo.
- Microsoft’s gaming strategy has shifted towards subscription and cloud services, yet they face ongoing challenges in hardware and game distribution.
- Game Pass hasn't transformed the industry as expected, with many consumers still purchasing games traditionally.
- The podcast discusses the implications of Microsoft's strategy and the future of gaming.

items.title: iPhone 16 Pro versus Galaxy S25 Ultra: which camera is better?
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
• Samsung announced the Galaxy S25 series, including the S25 Ultra, at the Unpacked event last month.
• Key features of the S25 Ultra include a 50-megapixel ultrawide lens, LOG video, and AI audio processing.
• The iPhone 16 Pro, released in September 2024, has similar features to the S25 Ultra.
• A review by Vjeran Pavic from The Verge compares both devices on noise, color, sound, and ease of use.

items.title: The Dune survival game launches in May, but you can build a character now
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Developer Funcom announced that *Dune: Awakening* will launch on Steam on May 20th.
- A character creator is available, allowing players to customize appearance, home planet, caste, and mentor, which affects starting abilities.
- A benchmark mode is also launched to test system performance, featuring scenes from the game such as flying with an ornithopter and encountering a sandworm.
- Both tools are available for free on Steam.

items.title: Scuf’s Valor Pro is a promising start for its Hall effect Xbox controllers
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- Scuf launched the $99.99 Valor Pro, its first wired controller approaching a budget price.
- The controller is available in 15 styles and is designed for both Xbox and PC.
- Features Hall effect thumb sticks to reduce stick drift, four programmable rear buttons, and adjustable game volume/chat mix dials.
- Ergonomically designed, with refined bumpers and rear paddles for easier access during gameplay.
- Supports a future update for a 1KHz polling rate for reduced input lag, beneficial for PC gamers.
- Compared to alternatives, it’s less customizable than the Xbox Elite Series 2 but more affordable.
- Contenders like the PowerA Fusion Pro offer similar features at lower prices but may lack the classic Xbox feel.

items.title: Spotify is making it easier to release audiobooks narrated by AI
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Spotify partners with ElevenLabs to accept AI-narrated audiobooks, expanding its audiobook market.
- Previously, AI audiobooks were allowed but with restrictions; now the process is more streamlined.
- ElevenLabs provides narration in 32 languages with varying synthetic voices, offering a cost-effective solution for authors.

items.title: Canon’s new PowerShot V1 puts video first
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Canon has launched the PowerShot V1, aimed at video content creators, featuring a wide-angle lens and a new sensor.
- It introduces customizable video "moods", a product demo mode with priority autofocus, and can record 4K/60p for over two hours due to a built-in cooling fan.
- Announced before the CP+ photography show, it is set to launch in late April 2025 in Asia, with pricing around $990 (148,500 yen) and wider availability to be confirmed.
- The camera has a 22.3-megapixel capability, with 15fps mechanical shutter and 30fps electronic options, but applies a 1.4x crop for 4K/60p video.
- Features include a 16-50mm f/2.8-4.5 zoom lens, Dual Pixel AF II system for advanced autofocus, and a vari-angle touchscreen for control, lacking an electronic viewfinder.

items.title: Twelve South’s Find My-compatible charger is on sale starting at just $49
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- The Twelve South PlugBug is a USB-C wall charger that can function with Apple's Find My network.
- Available for $49 (50W version) and $79.35 (120W version), with significant discounts.
- The charger features multiple USB-C ports for charging multiple devices simultaneously.
- It can help users locate the device through alerts and beeping sounds, enhancing usability while traveling.

items.title: Ring's New Outdoor Security Camera Offers 2K Video Right Out of the Box
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Ring has launched the Outdoor Cam Plus, its first outdoor security camera with 2K video support at launch.
- The camera features improved Wi-Fi and low-light capabilities, with real-time alerts and live streaming.
- Priced at $99.99, it will ship on March 26, 2025, and offers subscription-based features starting at $4.99/month for advanced functionalities.

items.title: This smart thermostat company is considering charging users for its app
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- Tado is contemplating a £1 / €1 monthly charge for app usage starting May 1, 2025.
- Users reported receiving notifications about the fee, with some seeing differing start dates for the charge.
- The charge is attributed to increased company costs; free integration with smart home platforms will remain.
- Tado currently has optional subscription fees for additional services, but app control has been free.
- Tado claims the notifications may be part of marketing tests, assuring users that no charges are currently enforced.
- The potential implementation of this fee could risk customer retention and product recommendations.

items.title: All the smart home news, reviews, and gadgets you need to know about
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The article covers the latest developments in smart home technology, including reviews and guides from companies like Apple, Amazon, Samsung, and Google.
- Users have reported that Tado plans to charge a monthly fee to control their smart thermostats via their app, starting in 2025.
- Eufy launched the FamiLock S3 Max, a smart lock that uses palm vein recognition.
- Apple is rumored to be developing a home robot that may take the form of a lamp.
- Research indicates users may not fully understand the security implications of outdated smart appliances.

items.title: It’s clearly time: all the news about the transparent tech renaissance
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Leaked images reveal a transparent color option for Sony’s upcoming ANC earbuds, the WF-C710N, expected in late May.
- Retro Remake has opened preorders for the SuperStation One, a PS One clone, with a Founders Edition sold out and standard edition available for $179.99.
- Xbox is launching the Pulse Cipher Special Edition controller featuring a deep-red transparent casing for $74.99.
- Asus announced its first Thunderbolt 5 external GPU, promising high power and connectivity for portable setups.
- Hyperkin is releasing a translucent green version of its Xbox Controller S, priced at $49.99, with details on availability pending.
- Anbernic launched the RG34XX Game Boy Advance clone with transparent color options and additional features for retro gaming.

items.title: The iPhone is done with home buttons — here’s why I’ll miss it
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Apple has announced the iPhone 16E, the first model without a home button since the iPhone's launch in 2007.
- The home button played a crucial role in the original iPhone, making it accessible for users new to smartphones.
- Over the years, the home button evolved to include features like Siri access and Touch ID, demonstrating its importance.
- The design of smartphones has progressed, leading to the decision to remove the home button for a more modern, full-screen experience.
- While users adapted to new navigation methods, the home button will be remembered for its legacy in smartphone innovation.

items.title: Oppo’s new foldable can remote control a Mac
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Oppo launched the Find N5, the thinnest book-style foldable phone available outside of China.
- The phone can connect to a Mac for file transfers and remote control through the O Plus Connect app.
- Users can browse and transfer files wirelessly between the phone and Mac as long as both are on the same Wi-Fi network.
- The remote control feature allows the phone to mirror the Mac's display, enabling a miniature laptop experience.
- Oppo's feature is a first for the brand, while a similar option was introduced by Vivo in April 2024 but is only available on China-exclusive devices.
- Plans to expand this feature to more Oppo phones are announced, though details are pending.

items.title: Oppo Find N5 review: the final evolution of foldables
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Oppo's Find N5 is regarded as the pinnacle of foldable phones, with no clear direction for future development.
- It features a thickness of 8.93mm when closed, making it the thinnest foldable phone to date and just 4.21mm when open.
- Equipped with a 5,600mAh battery and supports 50W wireless charging; features Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset for better efficiency.
- Offers impressive hardware specifications including an 8.12-inch main display with a nearly invisible crease.
- Cameras include a 50MP main and 3x telephoto, but the 8MP ultrawide is lacking; doesn’t launch in the US market; priced around $1,867.

items.title: The world’s thinnest foldable phone doesn’t come cheap
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Oppo has launched the Find N5, the thinnest foldable phone in the world, priced at $2,499 SGD (around $1,867 USD).
- The phone is slimmer than rivals, measuring 8.93mm when closed and 4.21mm at its thinnest point when open.
- It features an IPX6, X8, and X9 rating for water resistance but lacks dust protection.
- The display has a narrower and shallower crease to enhance usability.
- It is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, 16GB of RAM, and 512GB of storage.
- The Find N5 has impressive Hasselblad-branded cameras, including a 50MP main lens.
- Available in Europe and Asia, confirmed for a February 28 release in Singapore, but not launching in the US.

items.title: Twitch Limits Streamers to 100 Hours of Highlights and Uploads
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Twitch will introduce a 100-hour storage cap for Highlights and Uploads starting April 19th, leading to automatic deletions until content falls below this limit.
- The decision is based on the ineffectiveness of Highlights in driving engagement and the high cost of storage.
- Only Highlights and third-party uploads are affected; Clips and regular VODs remain untouched by the new policy.
- Streamers can download existing content before deletion begins with the least viewed Highlights, and a storage tracker will be introduced to assist.
- The decision particularly impacts the speedrunning community, whose records are often archived as Highlights, raising concerns about historical documentation.

items.title: Volvo’s ES90 sedan will be built with a Nvidia supercomputer
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- The ES90 is Volvo's next electric vehicle, featuring dual Nvidia Drive AGX Orin supercomputer for high computing capacity.
- Boasts capabilities of 508 trillion operations per second, enhancing active safety features and battery management.
- Built on Volvo’s SPA2 architecture with a modular tech stack called Superset, allowing for over-the-air updates and continuous improvements.
- Represents a significant jump in processing speeds, improving deep learning models from 40 million to 200 million parameters.
- Aims to improve vehicle features like driver assist technology and battery range over time, similar to Tesla's approach.

items.title: The best indie games we're playing right now
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Indie games are increasingly recognized for their creativity and unique storytelling.
- The Verge highlights a selection of indie games that may have flown under the radar.
- This list will be updated frequently, adding new recommendations for readers.

items.title: Rabbit shows off the AI agent it should have launched with
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Rabbit showcases a new 'generalist Android agent' demonstrating control over apps on a tablet.
- The demonstration differs from the original R1 device, which lacked capabilities.
- Users type requests on a laptop, and the agent executes tasks like finding YouTube videos and downloading games.
- The AI agent is still in development, showcasing a basic action loop for task completion.
- More updates about Rabbit's cross-platform multi-agent system are promised in the near future.

items.title: Nvidia Launches ‘Priority Access’ for RTX 5080 and 5090 FE GPUs
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Nvidia is launching a ‘Verified Priority Access’ program to help fans buy RTX 5080 and 5090 Founders Edition GPUs amid supply shortages.
- Interested users must apply through a form, demonstrating prior use of Nvidia services and existing accounts prior to January 30.
- The invites for this program will start rolling out next week, but it’s unclear how many GPUs will be available to participants.

items.title: Here are the best iPad deals right now
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- Many great iPad deals available outside major sales events like Black Friday and Amazon Prime Day.
- Current discounts on 10th-gen iPad starting at $296 at Amazon/Walmart.
- iPad Mini (2024) starting at $499, with deals on 128GB and 256GB models available.
- 2024 iPad Air priced at $499 for 11-inch model, matching its all-time low.
- iPad Pro (2024) features M4 chip, starting at $999 for the 11-inch model and $1,299 for 13-inch, with current sales bringing the prices down.
- Deals regularly checked and updated by The Verge's deal hunters.

items.title: Limited Run says potentially damaging NES carts are supplier's fault
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary: - Limited Run Games apologized for potential issues with NES cartridges for Rugrats: Adventures in Gameland and Piopow that could damage consoles. - The issue is due to improper voltage regulation from a supplier not regularly used by Limited Run. - Further shipments of the affected games are halted for re-manufacturing. - Customers can request refunds and will receive new versions if they purchased the games. - The company is reviewing other NES titles produced by the same manufacturer for similar issues.

items.title: The Last of Us season 2 finally has a premiere date
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- HBO announced that season 2 of *The Last of Us* will premiere on April 13th on HBO and Max.
- The second season will adapt parts of *The Last of Us Part II* and will consist of seven episodes, shorter than the first season.
- Season 2 takes place five years after the first season and introduces new characters, including Kaitlyn Dever as Abby and Isabela Merced as Dina.
- Character posters and a debut trailer have been released for promotional purposes.

items.title: The Last of Us: All the News About the Video Game Franchise Turned TV Series
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- New teaser trailer for season 2 reveals that Joel and Ellie are in for a challenging time.
- Catherine O'Hara has been cast in an undisclosed role for the second season.
- The Last of Us Part II Remastered adds new features like guitar playing mode and various outfits.
- Season 2 will be shorter than the first season, with a natural breakpoint expected after seven episodes.
- Neil Druckmann hints at a potential third installment in the series, expressing excitement about concepts for a new chapter.

items.title: A popular Japanese distraction-free writing device is coming to the US
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- King Jim is releasing the Pomera D250US, a distraction-free writing tool, in the US for the first time since 2018.
- The device features a US keyboard layout and an English dictionary, focusing solely on writing with no internet access.
- Funded through an Indiegogo campaign, early backers can preorder for $374, with retail pricing around $499, shipping starts in March 2025.
- The Pomera D250US has a 10.3-inch LCD display and offers a battery life of up to 20 hours, but limited built-in storage of 1.3GB.
- Users can expand storage with SD cards and transfer documents via USB-C, Wi-Fi, or Bluetooth using the Pomera Link app for iOS and Android.

items.title: Nvidia’s New 50-Series GPUs Lack Support for PhysX Games
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Nvidia has removed support for PhysX in its new RTX 50 series GPUs, affecting performance in games utilizing the technology.
- Users reported that games like Borderlands 2 are overly taxing CPU instead of GPU, leading to performance issues.
- Nvidia noted changes in support for 32-bit CUDA applications, which includes PhysX, but did not adequately communicate this removal to users.
- Older Nvidia cards, particularly the RTX 4080, have seen an increase in street price, indicating retained value despite the release of new models.

items.title: Verge staffers react to the iPhone 16E: what we love and don’t love
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Apple launched the new iPhone 16E priced at $599 with updated design and features like a USB-C port, a customizable Action Button, and an A18 chip.
- It will ship on February 28th, featuring a smaller design compared to the iPhone 16, but includes an OLED display.
- Staff opinions vary: some appreciate the absence of a home button, while others express disappointment over the lack of MagSafe.
- The iPhone 16E has a 48-megapixel rear camera and users find its size more pocket-friendly than larger models.
- Overall, the affordable price reflects modern features, appealing to users wanting premium devices without the hefty price tag.

items.title: The BBC's Library of Classic Sci-Fi Sounds is Now Available to Sample
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- The BBC Radiophonic Workshop is launching a downloadable library of music and sound effects, providing access to decades of original content.
- The library is priced at £119/€143/$159 until March 17th, after which it will increase to £149/€179/$199.
- It includes sounds from original tapes and fresh recordings from workshop members, showcasing varied audio equipment and techniques.

items.title: Rivian’s new Dune edition lets you channel your inner Fremen
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Rivian announced the California Dune edition of R1 electric vehicles with enhanced off-roading features.
- The Dune edition includes 20-inch All-Terrain wheels, new paint color inspired by desert tones, and protective underbody shield.
- Based on Rivian's tri-motor powertrain, it delivers 850 horsepower and 1,103 lb-ft of torque, accelerating 0-60 mph in 2.9 seconds with an EPA-estimated range of 329 miles.
- Pricing begins at $99,900 for the R1T truck and $105,900 for the R1S SUV.
- Interior features a two-tone Adventure design with durable floor mats, alongside various off-roading accessories available.
- Announcement comes before Rivian's earnings report for Q4 and full-year outlook for 2025.

items.title: Hades II gets a big update with a final boss and more story
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Hades II's second major update, the "Warsong Update," is now available.
- The update introduces a new final boss and Ares as a new god, with over 2,000 new voice lines.
- Supergiant Games is planning a third major update for Hades II in the coming months and has not announced the final 1.0 launch date.

items.title: All the news about Nvidia’s RTX 50-series GPUs
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Nvidia is set to launch RTX 5090 and RTX 5080 on January 30, 2025.
- The RTX 5070 will be launched on March 5, 2025, after a delay from February.
- The RTX 5070 is marketed as being able to deliver RTX 4090-level performance for $549.
- Nvidia's RTX 50-series laptop preorders begin on February 25, 2025.
- The RTX 5090 and 5080 are expected to have significant demand, with warnings of possible stock shortages.

items.title: Here’s when and where you can preorder the new iPhone 16E
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- Apple announced the iPhone 16E, releasing on February 28th.
- Preorders start February 21st at 8AM ET, with the base model priced at $599 for 128GB storage.
- It features an A18 chip, a 6.1-inch OLED display, a customizable Action Button, and a 48MP camera with 2x optical zoom.

items.title: Here are the best AirPods deals you can get right now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Discounts available on Apple’s AirPods lineup including AirPods Max and AirPods 4.
- Best deals for AirPods 4 include standard model at $119 and model with ANC at $148.99.
- Second-gen AirPods Pro available for $199, featuring USB-C charging and improved noise cancellation.
- AirPods Max discounted to $449 for first-gen and $529 for the new USB-C model.
- Discounts available from retailers like Amazon, Walmart, and Costco.

items.title: Apple gets into AI: all the news on iOS 18, macOS Sequoia, and more
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The rollout of iOS 18.2 includes Apple Intelligence features and ChatGPT integration.
- Apple is collaborating with Alibaba to launch AI tools in China.
- iOS 18.3 updates could inadvertently reactivate Apple Intelligence for users who previously disabled it.
- Apple plans to support multiple languages for its AI tools starting in April.
- Notification summaries for news and entertainment apps on iOS 18.3 have been temporarily disabled due to prior inaccuracies.

items.title: Apple no longer sells new iPhones with Lightning ports
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Apple stops selling new iPhones with Lightning ports, launching the iPhone 16E and discontinuing the iPhone 14 and third-generation iPhone SE.
- All new iPhones are equipped with USB-C ports, marking a significant shift away from the Lightning port introduced with the iPhone 5 over a decade ago.
- Some accessories that still use Lightning ports are still available, including the first-generation Apple Pencil and various adapters.

items.title: The Rabbit R1: all the latest news about this hare-raising AI gadget
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The Rabbit R1 sold 40,000 units within 8 days of its CES launch in January 2024.
- It features an AI-powered Rabbit OS that interacts with apps like Spotify and Uber.
- The device is designed by Teenage Engineering with a 2.88-inch touchscreen and a rotating camera.
- Rabbit is introducing a "teach mode" that allows users to guide the AI on performing specific tasks.
- Only 5,000 of the 100,000 Rabbit R1 users are active at any given moment, indicating a drop in usage since launch.

items.title: This 1.9-pound smartphone’s massive battery offers six months of standby
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Oukitel WP100 Titan features a 33,000mAh battery, offering 4,459 hours of standby (about 6 months).
- Available through a [Kickstarter campaign](https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1006830823/oukitel-wp100-titan-33000mah-rugged-phone-with-projector) with a funding goal of $10,000, it has already surpassed this target.
- Preorders start at $599 with shipping expected as early as April 2025.
- Equipped with a 2.5GHz MediaTek Dimensity 7300 processor, 16GB RAM, and 512GB storage.
- Offers up to 289 hours of talk time and 49 hours of video playback on a 6.8-inch, 120Hz display.
- Comes with a 1,200-lumen LED camp light and a built-in projector (100 lumens).
- IP68 rated for water resistance, features a 200MP main camera, and runs Android 14 out of the box.

items.title: Nightreign is shaping up to be a fast and frantic take on Elden Ring
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The Verge staff shared their experiences with the network tests of Elden Ring Nightreign, highlighting its fast-paced, co-op-focused gameplay.
- Players enjoyed the frantic nature of the game but encountered troublesome connection issues.
- Elden Ring Nightreign is officially set to release on May 30th.
- The game's battle royale elements force players to act quickly, shifting from the slower-paced exploration typical of the original game.
- Some players found the need for a robust communication system due to the lack of in-game voice chat, instead using Discord to strategize.
- Concerns were raised about network stability and potential problems with player communication during gameplay.

items.title: Murena released a de-Googled version of the Pixel Tablet
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Murena has launched its first tablet, the Murena Pixel Tablet, which is a privacy-focused device running /e/OS, removing Google’s apps and services.
- The tablet is priced at $549 and features 128GB of storage, compared to Google’s Pixel Tablet price of $399 for the same storage.
- It eliminates the Google Play Store but offers an App Lounge for downloading apps anonymously, with a limitation on paid app downloads.

items.title: How the new iPhone 16E compares to the rest of Apple’s iPhone 16 lineup
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Apple announced the iPhone 16E, a budget-friendly option priced at $599.
- It features a 6.1-inch OLED screen, Face ID, USB-C port, and runs on the A18 chip.
- Preorders start on February 21, 2025, with availability on February 28, 2025.
- Battery life is up to 26 hours of video playback, four hours more than the iPhone 16.
- Lacks some features like the ultrawide camera, Camera Control button, and MagSafe compatibility.
- Key specs compared to other models are summarized in a detailed table, highlighting differences in performance and features.

items.title: 8 important things to know about the iPhone 16E
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- Apple announced the iPhone 16E with a starting price of $599, making it the most affordable in the iPhone lineup. 
- The iPhone 16E is eSIM-only in the U.S., eliminating physical SIM card support. 
- The phone has transitioned from Lightning to USB-C for charging and data transfer, limited to USB 2 speeds. 
- MagSafe is not included, and while it supports wireless charging, magnetic accessory compatibility is absent. 
- Features a customizable Action Button, similar to the iPhone 15 Pro. 
- First iPhone to use Apple’s own C1 modem, promising improved battery life, though performance comparison to Qualcomm is pending. 
- The camera offers a 48-megapixel Fusion camera but does not support macro photography. 
- Upgrading to 512GB storage will cost an additional $300, bringing the total to $899. 
- The display is capped at 60Hz refresh rate. 
- Preorders start this Friday, with a release date on February 28th.

items.title: iPhone 16E: all the news on Apple’s new $599 phone
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Apple introduced the iPhone 16E, a successor to the iPhone SE, featuring a new design with Face ID and a notch.
- It is powered by Apple's A18 chip and comes equipped with the new C1 5G modem, claimed to be the most power-efficient modulator.
- The iPhone 16E has a 6.06-inch OLED display, customizable Action Button, USB-C port, no MagSafe support, and a single 48MP rear camera.
- Preorders start on February 21st, 2025, with a launch date set for February 28th, and prices starting at $599.

items.title: Google Chrome is adding a Circle to Search-like feature for iPhones
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Google is introducing a new search feature for iPhone users in the Google app and Chrome browser, allowing them to highlight items on the screen for quick searches.
- The Lens gestures enable searches across text, images, and videos without needing screenshots or new tabs.
- This feature resembles Android’s Circle to Search, although iOS limitations restrict it to Google apps.
- Users can activate it via the three-dot menu and are encouraged to use intuitive gestures to highlight for searches.
- Upcoming updates will add a Lens icon to the address bar for quicker access.

items.title: Instagram Introduces Scheduled and Pinned DMs
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- Instagram now allows users to schedule direct messages up to 29 days in advance.
- Users can pin up to three messages at the top of their chat for better visibility.
- New features aim to assist with messaging across time zones and to highlight important messages in busy chats.
- Additional features include inviting friends to group chats via QR codes and translating messages in 99 languages.
- Users can share music natively within the app, enabling shared listening experiences.
